subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Friends and Family Round: The Awkward First Check
description: Learn Friends and Family Round: The Awkward First Check in one minute.

hook.text: Jeff Bezos raised $300K from 22 peopleâ€”mostly his parents' friends. Amazon almost wasn't.

buildup.text: The friends-and-family round is often the first outside money: $10K-$150K from people who trust you.

discovery.text: These investors bet on you, not your spreadsheet. Relationship is the only due diligence.

twist.text: If the startup fails, Thanksgiving gets awkward. Mixing money and relationships is genuinely risky.

climax.text: Smart founders treat F&F money like professional investment: written terms, clear risks, no promises.

punchline.text: Take their money seriously, even if they don't.

quiz.question: What's the biggest risk of a friends-and-family funding round?
options: Failure can damage personal relationships since investors bet on trust, not data
Friends and family always demand too much equity
